2.author: Assurgavemeabrother
2.body:
Not on Amazon, but you can purchase slaves even today. Anyway, the point is that dating complies with all science related to behavior of market participants. You don't search for just "a wheel", you need a very particular wheel. The same with tea, candies, or a house. You have a list of requirements that you can modify and also the core ones that you absolutely cannot forfeit, and if **nothing** appears on the list you just keep looking/waiting.

It does not matter for you that your requirements may be too specific, statistically a minority. Hell, even a nanority. You do not live in statistics, you live your own life.

Alright, you wanna know what I look like so badly? I’ll tell you the god’s honest truth. I’m a 5’10” white woman who turned 31 in December of this year. My ass is flat but I’ve got a sort of skinny hourglass figure and my legs are too long for my body. I dress mostly in big wool sweaters and mini skirts with tights with satin bows tying my hair up. But I’m also a filthy slob when I’m at home most of the time. Duality of man and such shit. I’m half tempted to show you a screenshot of my tinder to prove it, but I made this burner account specifically because too many people on this sub have zero concept of boundaries and I don’t want someone reverse image searching my pics and finding me and trying to ruin my life for being a feminist on Reddit. But I have no reason to lie. And while this could potentially be a nice meet cute in another universe, I couldn’t ever go further in chatting or flirting with you because, while I may personally not be overweight, I have people whom I dearly love who ARE overweight. Or who are lates 30s cat ladies. Or who have a visible disability. And I have talked with them about their struggles and how much it hurts to see people use their body type or circumstance or disability as an insult, even if they’re trying to be funny. So out of solidarity to them, I would kick your ass to the curb for this behavior no matter how we clicked or if I found you heartstoppingly attractive. 

Thank you for your kind words and, next time, try skipping straight to the banter and candor and skip the other, more insulting, parts. Cheers and have a good life.

36.author: Huns26
36.body:
There’s an option to say long term but open to short term which I’m fine with. But if they say looking for short term but open to long, it’s likely a no because I know I don’t want to enter a relationship with someone who just sees it as something casual, I want to be on the same page and I’m not looking to do relationship things with a person unless I know they’re also looking for a relationship 
That way I don’t get attached to someone who isn’t looking for something serious
And if their bio says casual or short term fun it’s straight up no

36.author: Wylie28
36.body:
so short term, implies hook ups only? Hm. I never put that together. Looking at "short term open to long term" I have assumed that they literally just meant a shorter version of long term. As in an actual serious relationship, that just would end when it needed to. While I find the idea bonkers, I can totally see why it would be appealing to some. You get to have relationships, but not get tied down to one person. And if what both of you are wanting. You both win. That exists.

However. I just put two and two together and realized "short-term" is short term for "short-term \*fun\*".  Aka hook up. Which sounds a LOT more mainstream and now I see why its a common tag. I was confused on how such a wacky idea was on all these dating apps when "I really want a long term relationship, but give im single and ill take what I can get im open to hook ups too" felt like it would be something people would use a lot more.

Turns out I was right..... about thinking the thing I was wrong about didn't make sense. I just never thought to add the word fun on the end. I guess to me it felt like it was left out for a reason.

36.author: Wylie28
36.body:
Oh and. While I still probably won't use it. Ty for the heads up the order of the 4 words matters. Because I didn't pick up om that either.  Assuming the order of two statements defines their importance is a big logical fallacy. There is an actual English reason you would use open and looking in that phrase instead of just looking.  "looking for short, looking for long" sounds dumb and doesn't flow like "looking for short, and open to long". Its repetitive. There is an actual reason looking for, and open to, would have exactly the same magnitude. It just simply sounds better that way. In the court of law, you'd be laughed out of the room over that implication.

HOWEVER. Human behavior isn't logical and is always breaking logical reasoning. And I do believe you.

Its one of those ways people have mind reading capabilities that me (and most other people on the spectrum) just don't have. And its REALLY annoying when people apply that to me and I don't know it exists.

I have been very frustrated because I ordered it "looking for hook-ups, open to long". Just because going least important to important makes sense to me. You remember that last thing someone says more than the first. Logically the order is arbitrary anyway. And the phrase "looking for" always precedes "open to" in those statements. So I kept them in the same order as everyone else just because. I would write an entire paragraph on how I was far far more serious about the relationship than hookups to try and clear up this misunderstanding. And people didn't fucking care. And seemingly just decided my own intentions for me against my word.

To me this just felt "man like sex = bad man". Which is super sexist and very accepted in many parts of society rn. So I had no reason to think otherwise.

But. In reality they were trying to read my mind as if it functioned like a normal person. Weren't they? Which of course it won't work on with people who's minds form neurological connections fundamentally differently. (neurodivergence)

38.author: AlexFromOgish
38.body: aggressive answer.  As it happens, I grew up in a hunting/fishing family, and went on to get  a degree in natural resources and public lands, and have been around this stuff for almost four decades since.  I cheer for women (and kids) getting into ethical hunting/fishing in the Aldo Leopold tradition.  But I also understand demographics and math.   To this day, its a white (Euro-descent) male dominated thing, and ..... feel free to disagree..... if you took the macho vibe out of hunting in the year 2022, only about 10% - maybe - would have engaged in the activity.    .............   Those rebuttals aside, you imply everyone owes a debt of gratitude to hunters/fishers for the amount of state and federal public lands that have been set aside in the US, and I couldn't agree more.   I'd absolutely LOVE to take all my left leaning pro gun control friends to a range and teach them to shoot responsibly and safely so they have that lived experience to inform them when they talk about hunting and gun control.   Can we be friends now ?

56.author: dole_banana
56.body:
I worry when I feel it's necessary, I don't start panicking when I send my gf a "how's your day?" And she doesn't respond for a few hours while she's at work. Specifically in this case, she's a teacher and doesn't go on her phone while she's with students. If I freaked out every time she didn't respond to me for a while, our relationship would've ended a while ago.

Edit: To clarify, I do agree that if you feel someone is important you should want a relatively prompt response from them. I also believe that if my relationship is healthy enough, I should be able to withstand a moderate amount of time without a reply, knowing that I will receive one when my SO is able.

56.author: Traditional_Moose655
56.body: You know your girlfriends schedule already though so you know why she won’t reply for awhile. With dating now days it just seems shady because everyone is talking to 5 people at a time. I don’t know and maybe it’s because I’m still young that most people aren’t working 9-5s yet I don’t thinks it’s hard to just be like “hey I gotta a crazy work/school schedule I won’t be able to talk too much right now” it’s reassuring to me to know you’re not just ignoring me and that you’re also okay, because I know if I’m upset I withdraw from people so my mind also goes there like are they okay. It’s never like I can’t believe he didn’t message in five minutes or it took him 4 hours to reply. I mean like a full day or more no contact. But as I said a quick message in the morning isn’t hard, and I’m the type of person that when I’m really about someone I will message them every morning when I wake up and every night before bed and I’d like someone who’s like me in that way. It’s a nice way to check in at least once a day with each other.

56.author: dole_banana
56.body: Well, I don't think you're wrong about anything you've said here. Full day or more especially early on seems a bit ghosty, I always try to give people the BotD, but it's certainly harder in an app of all places than in an established relationship. I was just saying I try to be as open as possible to someone's schedule, and try not to assume their being rude just because they haven't answered. You're right, a quick message isn't difficult... but sometimes someone is just running late, or isn't feeling well, or maybe just had a bad day and doesn't want to look at their phone. I really am trying to see it from both sides here, and you make excellent arguments (especially because I'm pretty sure my SO and I haven't actually gone a full day without checking in since we started dating). I understand your perspective, just wanted to say that not everyone has bad intentions in this situation, and I now know you understand that.

56.author: Traditional_Moose655
56.body: I’m fairly jaded at this point because most have just proven to me that giving the BotD was too good for them. I try not assume anything and won’t double text if don’t hear from them to give space to be sure because you are right you never know what’s going on but it does make me reevaluate where I see things going especially if they just reappear like nothing happened

56.author: Traditional_Moose655
56.body: When you’re in that getting to know someone phase and things are still very uncertain and you’re not “official”, because now there are so many steps just to get to boyfriend/girlfriend status, that communication is key for building something. Once something is established then yes I completely agree that our relationship should be able to withstand not being in contact all the time but at that point you most likely have a system, check in at night before bed or whatever it may be. Like I don’t see how someone you’re serious about could go the whole day without at least just saying “hey I’m okay and we’ll talk later/tomorrow/etc.” or having a quick check in with other to make sure you’re both good.

56.author: dole_banana
56.body: I agree and I totally get where you're coming from, I just have this set image in my head from the show "Dave" where the main character is set to go out with Doja Cat, and totally blows his chance because he doesn't get a response all day and blows up on her. It just put an idea in my mind to be as patient as possible, but this is an obvious bias.

56.author: Traditional_Moose655
56.body: I give a grace period of like 2 days before I become disinterested in that person tbh once you go past it you can message me all you want but I won’t make any plans with you anymore or put more effort in than the bare minimum, because at that point it makes me feel like I’m investing more of myself into something the other person isn’t showing much interest towards. Lagging when making plans or plans have already been made is an even bigger pet peeve of mine. Like why are you gonna waste my time like that? If something comes up let me know in a decent time. I won’t blow up on you for not texting back but if we had plans you lag and then stand me up on those plans with no explanation until after said plans were supposed happen I’m gonna be sassy and probably never text back again. It would have to be an iron class reason for me to even consider making plans with you again.

62.author: Flashy_Yam967
62.body:
I have thought the same thing and done what you're talking about doing. 

When transported, you will appear in the transported spot and within their away search results but your distance will be the real distance away. I think your matches won't even know you're transported because the only thing they will see is your distance from them....all this you can throw off by hiding your distance  or opening the app only when on a VPN.
